what: rCNV: An R package for detecting copy number variants from SNPs data
title: Detecting CNV from SNPs: a quick guide to rCNV
text: Piyal Karunarathne, Qiujie Zhou, Pascal Milesi tutorial provides complete guide detecting CNVs SNPs data using rCNV package. includes importing raw VCF files, filtering , normalization read depth, categorization SNPs “deviants” “non-deviants”, SNPs located putative CNV regions filtered. brief workflow presented Fig 1. . data used tutorial available either withing package GitHub repository https://github.com/piyalkarum/rCNV/tree/master/testDATA. provide complete workflow detecting CNVs SNPs, starting raw (unfiltered) VCF number 1 workflow chart. However, one believes filtered VCFs parameters highlight (see Fig.1 sub-sections 1.2 1.3), can start number 2 workflow shown .
code: # Start by installing the package if you haven't already done so.   # To install the CRAN version install.packages("rCNV")  # Or if you would like to install the development version of the package if (!requireNamespace("devtools", quietly = TRUE))      install.packages("devtools")  devtools::install_github("piyalkarum/rCNV", build_vignettes = TRUE)

title: Detecting CNV from SNPs: a quick guide to rCNV
text: raw VCF files often contain missing data samples SNPs. retained, samples SNPs can introduce false positives negatives analysis. Therefore, must removed based missing percentage. function get.miss() determines missing percentages samples SNPs graphically visualize missing ranges 5% quantile values. recommend removing samples SNPs missing percentages higher 50%. following example demonstrates filtering Parrot Fish data Stockwell et al. (2016). generates list missing percentage tables SNPs samples plot similar Fig 1.2 missing percentages plotted. Users can also manually plot percentages discretion. , desired one type missing percentage (.e. per sample per SNP) can calculated separately specifying argument type= get.miss() function. See help page get.miss() information. plot shows several samples missing data 50% SNPs. recommended remove proceeding analysis. Removing imported vcf file just matter obtaining columns (samples) missing percentage >50%. removed 5 samples undesired analysis due missing data. Undesired SNPs can also removed way; Note: now rows.
code: #download the parrotfish data (Stockwell et al. 2016) file from the following link to your working directory if you do not have the github folder #https://github.com/piyalkarum/rCNV/blob/master/testDATA/Parrotfish_sequenceReads.vcf.gz #and specify the path fl= to your file. fl<-"../testDATA/Parrotfish_sequenceReads.vcf.gz" parrot<-readVCF(fl,verbose=F) mss<-get.miss(parrot,verbose = F, plot=F) head(mss$perSample) #>   indiv n_miss     f_miss #> 1  DP_1   1089 0.05726455 #> 2 DP_10   1086 0.05710680 #> 3 DP_11   1365 0.07177788 #> 4 DP_12   1091 0.05736972 #> 5 DP_13   1069 0.05621286 #> 6 DP_14    387 0.02035021 dim(parrot$vcf) #> [1] 19017   105 sam<-which(mss$perSample$f_miss>0.5)+9 #here we determine the sample columns with f_miss>0.5 and add 9 to get the correct column number because there are 9 more columns before the sample columns start. parrot<-data.frame(parrot$vcf)[,-sam] dim(parrot) #> [1] 19017   100

what: 1.3 Assessing the relatedness among samples and heterozygosity within
title: Detecting CNV from SNPs: a quick guide to rCNV
text: function relatedness() rCNV package generate relatedness index pairs samples according Yang et al. (2010). output data frame pairs samples relatedness score Ajk. Please read Yang et al. (2010) information calculation Ajk. relatedness plots, can see relatedness Parrot fish samples low. recommend removing one sample pairs outlier values 0.9.  Figure 1.3. . Relatedness among samples, b. Heterozygosity Parrotfish populations Heterozygosity within populations can calculated using h.zygosity() function.   * NOTE: list populations corresponding samples must provided order plot heterozygosity among populations. figure 1.3.b, can see individuals mean heterozygosity FIS close 0.19, except outliers. However, outliers FIS value -0.2 highly likely DNA contamination. Therefore, recommended remove samples.
code: rels<-relatedness(parrot) head(rels) pops<-substr(colnames(parrot)[-c(1:9)],1,2) #population codes (the first two letters of the sample names) hz<-h.zygosity(parrot,pops=pops) head(hz)

what: 1.4 Generating allele depth tables and normalized depth values
title: Detecting CNV from SNPs: a quick guide to rCNV
text: Allele read depth table main data used rest analysis. Therefore, generated stored later use immensely save lot time. function hetTgen() especially dedicated purpose. Apart generating filtered allele depth table separate alleles (info.type="AD"), function can also generate total allele depth (info.type="AD-tot"), genotype table (info.type="GT"), etc.. See help page hetTgen() formats. additional step, rCNV framework corrects allele depth values genotype misclassifications (genotype depth values match) odd number anomalies (total depth loci odd). recommended normalize allele depth values across samples order avoid depth variation arise sequencing heterogeneity samples tend higher depth values compared others due different origin sequencing efforts. provide several methods normalizing data. | TMM = trimmed mean M values | MedR = median ratio normalization | QN = quantile based normalization | pca = PCA based normalization *Please read function help information different methods Table 1.4.1 Normalized allele depth table Compare allele depth values tables 1.4.0 1.4.1.
code: ad.tab<-hetTgen(parrot,info.type="AD") ad.tab[1:10,1:6] #the genotype table is needed for correcting the genotype mismatches gt<-hetTgen(parrot,info.type = "GT") ad.tab<-ad.correct(ad.tab,gt.table = gt) #normalize depth table with cpm.normal() ad.nor<-cpm.normal(ad.tab,method="MedR") ad.nor[1:6,1:6] #> OUTLIERS DETECTED #> Consider removing the samples: #> KKOGR07_0030 KKOGR07_0043_combo KKOKT10_0069

title: Detecting CNV from SNPs: a quick guide to rCNV
text: step, statistics necessary detecting duplicates calculated. include following: . Allele ratios (across samples), b. Proportions homo-/hetero-zygotes per SNP, c. Depth ratios (alternative/sum), d. Z-score, e. Chi-square significance, f. excess heterozygosity Alternative allele ratio calculated across samples depth values; Proportion homo/hetero-zygotes also calculated across samples per SNP; Depth ratio calculated per individual per SNP dividing alternative allele depth value total depth value alleles. calculated heterozygotes homozygotes; Z-score per SNP calculated according following equation:   Ni total depth heterozygote SNP x, NAi alternative allele read depth heterozygote SNP x, p probability sampling allele SNP x - unbiased sequencing, 0.5. allele.info() function calculates 0.5 biased probability using ratio reference alternative alleles. Chi-squared values per SNP per sample calculated using following equation:   Ni total depth heterozygote SNP x, NAi alternative allele read-depth heterozugote SNP x, p probability sampling allele SNP x heterozygotes - unbiased sequencing, 0.5, n number heterozygotes SNP x. addition -e parameters several important statistics per sample per SNP generated allele.info() output.

title: Detecting CNV from SNPs: a quick guide to rCNV
text: step, allele information table generated previous step used detect deviant SNPs based different models (statistics), used next step appropriate test statistic filter putative CNVs. rCNV function dupGet() delivers easy pick model selection detect deviant SNPs plotting option visualize detection. detection deviant SNPs based heterozygosity within populations (among samples) allelic ratios within heterozygotes. , dupGet() function implements three methods flag deviant alleles; ) Excess heterozygotes, b) Heterozygous SNPs depth values follow normal Z-score distribution, c) Heterozygous SNPs depth values follow normal chi-square distribution.   proportion heterozygotes population according HWE 2pq homozygotes q2. deviant SNPs heterozygosity expected higher indicating excess heterozygosity thus flagged deviant/putative-CNVs.   non-duplicated alleles (non-CNVs), median allele ratio must ~0.5, however, deviants, varies 1:3 3:1. SNP deviants also flagged putative CNVs. determine deviation, use Z-score values Chi-square significance calculated previous step.   **NOTE: users can select expected allele frequency (p: ) alternative allele based sequencing method probe bias therein. See publication https://doi.org/10.1101/2022.10.14.512217 details probe bias. function also plots deviants Allele median ratio Vs Proportion Heterozygotes visualize validate detection user. Users can also plot detection separately output dupGet() using dup.plot() function.
code: # Run this code for a demonstration of the detection dvs<-dupGet(alleleINF,test = c("z.05","chi.05")) # z score and chi-square values given p=0.05 is used here because the data is RADseq generated and probe-biase is neglegible  head(dvs) deviants<-dupGet(alleleINF,test = c("z.all","chi.all"),plot=TRUE,verbose = TRUE) head(deviants) #>       CHROM    POS     ID NHet    propHet  medRatio NHomRef NHomAlt propHomAlt #> 7452     un 705339  67808    9 0.08653846 0.5000000      95       0 0.00000000 #> 18079    un 769896  80692   41 0.40594059 0.5000000      48      12 0.11881188 #> 9793     un 926883 109573   54 0.51923077 0.5096539      34      16 0.15384615 #> 10122    un  18102   1703    8 0.07619048 0.5174242      97       0 0.00000000 #> 816      un  76725   6991   49 0.47115385 0.4897959      35      20 0.19230769 #> 17482    un 713297  72437   46 0.43809524 0.5217593      52       7 0.06666667 #>       Nsamp   eH.pval   eH.delta    dup.stat #> 7452    104 0.6446423  0.3894231 non-deviant #> 18079   101 0.4819957 -3.0841584 non-deviant #> 9793    104 0.4719765  3.5576923 non-deviant #> 10122   105 0.6848750  0.3047619 non-deviant #> 816     104 0.7008333 -1.9182692 non-deviant #> 17482   105 0.4523861  3.1428571 non-deviant

title: Detecting CNV from SNPs: a quick guide to rCNV
text: SNPs located putative CNV regions filtered using two methods; 1) intersection: using combination least two statistics used deviant detection. .e., excess heterozygotes, Z-score distribution Chi-square distribution, 2) K-means: using unsupervised clustering based Z-score, chi-square, excess heterozygotes, coefficient variation read-depth dispersion. significant SNPs either filtering flagged putative duplicates. users can pick range optimal statistics (e.g. z.,chi.,z.05,chi.05, etc.) depending nature (also sequencing technology) underlying data. function cnv() dedicated purpose.
code: CV<-cnv(alleleINF, test=c("z.05","chi.05"), filter = "kmeans") # see the difference between deviants and duplicates table(deviants$dup.stat) table(CV$dup.stat) #>  #>     deviant non-deviant  #>         335        2522 #>  #>     cnv non-cnv  #>     387    2470

text: test validity detected duplicates two ways: 1. direct detection sliding window 2. variant fixation index sliding window method assess duplication along chromosomes/scaffolds given size (e.g., 10,000 bp) sliding window. step assumes ideally, locus truly located multi-copy region, close-SNPs also classified deviants deviation caused sequencing error scattered along genome. putative duplicates follow assumption flagged low-confident can removed desired. function dup.validate rCNV package dedicated detecting regions enriched deviant SNPs within sliding window along chromosome, scaffold, sequence given length. ** method still beta-testing ** Variant fixation index (\(V_{ST}\) : Redon et al. 2006) analogous population fixation index (\(F_{ST}\)) calculated \(V_{ST} = V_S/V_T\) \(V_T\) variance normalized read depths among individuals two populations VS average variance within population, weighed population size; used identify distinct CNV groups populations (See Dennis et al., 2017; Weir & Cockerham, 1984) function vst can used calculate \(V_{ST}\) values per population plot genetic distance network qgraph. Fig. 3.1. Vst network qgraph generated Vst values lobster population. Circles represent populations green arrows show similarity direction.See qgraph help interpretation network analysis.
code: # the dataset used here is from Dorrant et al. 2020 of American lobster populations in Gulf of St. Lawrence, Canada vdata<-readRDS("../testDATA/lobster_data4Vst.rds") # get the total depth values of the duplicated snps # You can either use the following line to get the total depth of the samples or use the "tot" option of the hetTgen function to generate the total depth table dd<-rCNV:::apply_pb(vdata[,-c(1:4)],2,function(x){do.call(cbind,lapply(x,function(y){sum(as.numeric(unlist(strsplit(as.character(y),","))))}))}) pops<-substr(colnames(dd),1,4) dd<-data.frame(vdata[,1:4],dd) Vs<-vst(dd,pops=pops)

title: Find CNVs from deviants — cnv
text: Returns data frame SNPs detected duplication status

title: Find CNVs from deviants — cnv
text: SNP deviants detected excess heterozygosity according HWE deviant SNPs depth values fall outside normal distribution detected using following methods: Z-score test \(Z_{x} = \sum_{=1}^{n} Z_{}\); \(Z_{} = \frac{\left ( (N_{}\times p)- N_{Ai} \right )}{\sqrt{N_{}\times p(1-p)}}\) chi-square test \(X_{x}^{2} = \sum_{-1}^{n} X_{}^{2}\); \(X_{}^{2} = (\frac{(N_{}\times p - N_{Ai})^2}{N_{}\times p} + \frac{(N_{}\times (1 - p)- (N_{} - N_{Ai}))^2}{N_{}\times (1-p)})\) See references details methods Users can pick among Z-score heterozygotes (z.het, chi.het), allele combinations (z., chi.) assumption probe bias p=0.5 (z.05, chi.05) filter determine whether intersection kmeans clustering provided tests used filtering CNVs. intersection uses threshold values filtering kmeans use unsupervised clustering. Kmeans clustering recommended one uncertain threshold values.

text: hetTgen extracts read depth coverage values snp individuals vcf file generated readVCF (GatK VariantsToTable: see details)

title: Generate allele depth or genotype table — hetTgen
code: hetTgen(   vcf,   info.type = c("AD", "AD-tot", "GT", "GT-012", "GT-AB", "DP"),   verbose = TRUE )

title: Generate allele depth or genotype table — hetTgen
text: vcf imported vcf file list using readVCF info.type character. AD: allele depth value, AD-tot:total allele depth, DP=unfiltered depth (sum), GT: genotype, GT-012:genotype 012 format, GT-AB:genotype AB format. Default AD,  See details. verbose logical. whether show progress analysis

title: Generate allele depth or genotype table — hetTgen
text: Returns data frame allele depth, genotype SNPs individuals extracted VCF file

title: Generate allele depth or genotype table — hetTgen
text: generate depth values allele sample using GatK VariantsToTable option, use -F CHROM -F POS -GF AD flags generate table. keep CHROM, POS, ID, ALT, individual AD columns. info.type GT option provided extract genotypes individuals snp.

title: Generate allele depth or genotype table — hetTgen
text: Piyal Karunarathne, Klaus Schliep

what: Calculate normalization factor for each sample — norm.fact
title: Calculate normalization factor for each sample — norm.fact
text: function calculates normalization factor sample using different methods. See details.

title: Calculate normalization factor for each sample — norm.fact
code: norm.fact(   df,   method = c("TMM", "TMMex", "MedR", "QN"),   logratioTrim = 0.3,   sumTrim = 0.05,   Weighting = TRUE,   Acutoff = -1e+10 )

title: Calculate normalization factor for each sample — norm.fact
text: df data frame matrix allele depth values (total depth per snp per sample) method character. method used (see details). Default TMM logratioTrim numeric. percentage value (0 - 1) variation trimmed log transformation sumTrim numeric. amount trim use combined absolute levels (“” values) method TMM Weighting logical, whether compute (asymptotic binomial precision) weights Acutoff numeric, cutoff “” values use trimming

title: Calculate normalization factor for each sample — norm.fact
text: Returns numerical vector normalization factors sample

title: Calculate normalization factor for each sample — norm.fact
text: Originally described normalization RNA sequences (Robinson & Oshlack 2010), function computes normalization (scaling) factors convert observed library sizes effective library sizes. uses method trimmed means M-values proposed Robinson & Oshlack (2010). See original publication edgeR package information. method MedR median ratio normalization; QN - quantile normalization (see  Maza, Elie, et al. 2013 comparison methods).

title: Calculate normalization factor for each sample — norm.fact
text: Robinson MD, Oshlack (2010). scaling normalization method differential expression analysis RNA-seq data. Genome Biology 11, R25 Robinson MD, McCarthy DJ Smyth GK (2010). edgeR: Bioconductor package differential expression analysis digital gene expression data. Bioinformatics 26

title: Calculate normalization factor for each sample — norm.fact
text: Piyal Karunarathne

title: Calculate normalization factor for each sample — norm.fact

title: Determine pairwise relatedness — relatedness
text: data frame individuals relatedness score \(A_{jk}\)

title: Determine pairwise relatedness — relatedness

title:
Get sequencing quality statistics of raw VCF files
(with GatK generated vcf files only) — vcf.stat
text: Returns data frame quality parameters INFO. field vcf QUAL: Phred-scaled probability REF/ALT polymorphism exists site given sequencing data AC: Allele count AF: Allele frequency DP: unfiltered depth QD: QualByDepth - variant confidence (QUAL field) divided unfiltered depth non-hom-ref samples FS: FisherStrand - Phred scaled probability strand bias site SOR: StrandOddsRatio - another way estimate strand bias using test similar symmetric odds ratio test MQ: RMSMappingQuality - root mean square mapping quality reads site MQRankSum: MappingQualityRankSumTest - u-based z-approximation Rank Sum Test mapping qualities ReadPosRankSum: ReadPosRankSumTest: u-based z-approximation Rank Sum Test site position within reads

title: Calculate population-wise Vst — vst
text: function calculates Vst (variant fixation index) populations given list duplicated loci

title: Calculate population-wise Vst — vst
code: vst(AD, pops, id.list = NULL, qGraph = TRUE, verbose = TRUE, ...)

title: Calculate population-wise Vst — vst
text: AD data frame total allele depth values (duplicated, id.list provided) SNPs pops character. vector population names individual. Must length number samples AD id.list character. vector duplicated SNP IDs. Must match IDs AD data frame qGraph logical. Plot network plot based Vst values (see details) verbose logical. show progress ... additional arguments passed qgraph

title: Calculate population-wise Vst — vst
text: Returns matrix pairwise Vst values populations

title: Calculate population-wise Vst — vst
text: Vst calculated following equation $$V_{T} = \frac{ V_{S} }{V_{T}}$$ VT variance normalized read depths among individuals two populations VS average variance within population, weighed population size (see reference details) See qgraph help details qgraph output

title: Calculate population-wise Vst — vst
text: Redon, Richard, et al. Global variation copy number human genome. nature 444.7118 (2006)

title: Calculate population-wise Vst — vst
text: Piyal Karunarathne
